page.title: 11SHARESHILL CHURCH - HISTORY
page.content: Shareshill parish church according to tradition,should have been built on Saredon Hill.Legend says that the church was started,but whatever work was done in the day was pulled down at night by pixies living in the nearby woods,who removed the stones to their present site.A church has existed in the village since l2l3,the present building dates from l743.The total cost of building the church was 644.lls.lld. and was raised by church briefs and voluntary gifts.During renovations in l965 old paintings were found under the plaster on the west wall,the earliest being l4th century,also part of a l7th century painting executed in tempora on limewash.Unfortunately due to the dangerous condition of the wall the paintings had to be covered.
